content.text: Calculate the total amount she has after 5 years
Write 60 as the product of prime factors
Work out the highest common factor (HCF) of 48 and 60
Work out the lowest common multiple (LCM) of 48 and 60
Written as the product of prime factors \(48 = 2^{4} \times 3\)
Calculate the length of the diagonal \(EC\)
Calculate the angle between \(EC\) and the base \(EFGH\)
A rod has length \(2.9 \mathrm{m}\), correct to 1 decimal place
What is the upper bound for the length of the rod?
Will the rod fit completely in the box?
Give a reason for your answer
The diagram shows a box \(ABCDEFGH\) in the shape of a cuboid measuring \(2\mathrm{m}\) by \(1.5\mathrm{m}\) by \(1.7\mathrm{m}\)
The scale drawing shows the positions of two towns \(A\) and \(C\) on a map
On the map, 1 centimetre represents 20 kilometres
Find the distance in kilometres from town \(A\) to town \(C\)
Measure and write down the bearing of town \(C\) from town \(A\)
Town \(B\) is \(140\mathrm{km}\) from town \(C\) on a bearing of \(150^{\circ}\)
Mark accurately the position of town \(B\) on the scale drawing
Find the bearing of town \(C\) from town \(B\)
A lake on the map has an area of \(0.15 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Work out the actual area of the lake
A plane leaves town \(C\) at 11 57 and flies 1500 km to another town, landing at 14 12
Calculate the average speed of the plane
The diagram shows the distances between three towns \(P\), \(Q\) and \(R\)
Complete the table of values for the function \(y = x^{2} - \frac{3}{x}, x \neq 0.\)
Draw the graph of \(y = x^{2} - \frac{3}{x}\) for \(-3 \leqslant x \leqslant -0.25\) and \(0.25 \leqslant x \leqslant 3.\)
Draw the tangent to the curve where \(x = - 2.\)
Use the tangent to calculate an estimate of the gradient of the curve where \(x = - 2.\)
The area of this triangle is \(84 \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places
In which interval is the median time?
Using the mid-interval values 10, 27.5, ........calculate an estimate of the mean time
Complete the table of cumulative frequencies
On the grid, label the horizontal axis from 0 to 80, using the scale 1 cm represents 5 minutes and the vertical axis from 0 to 150, using the scale 1 cm represents 10 students
Draw a cumulative frequency diagram to show this information
the number of students whose time was in the range \(50 < \mathrm{t} \leqslant 60\),
the probability, as a fraction, that a student, chosen at random, took longer than 50 minutes,
the probability, as a fraction, that two students, chosen at random, both took longer than 50 minutes

content.text: The table shows the times taken, in minutes, by 150 students to complete their homework on one day
A solid pyramid has a **regular hexagon** of side \(2.5 \text{cm}\) as its base
Each sloping face is an isosceles triangle with base \(2.5 \text{cm}\) and height \(9.5 \text{cm}\)
Calculate the **total** surface area of the pyramid
A sector \(OAB\) has an angle of \(55^{\circ}\) and a radius of \(15\mathrm{cm}\)
Calculate the area of the sector and show that it rounds to \(108 \mathrm{cm}^2\), correct to 3 significant figures
Calculate the base radius of the cone
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\).]
Calculate the perpendicular height of the cone
The sector radii \(OA\) and \(OB\) in **part (b)** are joined to form a cone
A solid cone has the same dimensions as the cone in **part (c)**
A small cone with slant height \(7.5 \mathrm{cm}\) is removed by cutting parallel to the base
Calculate the volume of the remaining solid
[The volume, \(V,\) of a cone with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h.\) ]
Draw the enlargement of triangle \(P\) with centre \(A\) and scale factor 2
Describe fully the **single** transformation which maps shape \(Q\) onto shape \(R\)
Find the matrix which represents this transformation
Describe fully the **single** transformation which maps shape \(S\) onto shape \(T\)
Work out the first 3 terms of the sequence whose \(n\)th term is \(n(n + 2)\)
Which term in this sequence is equal to 168?
Find a formula for the \(n\)th term of the following sequences
A sequence of diagrams is formed by drawing equilateral triangles each of side one centimetre
The formula for the **total** number of one centimetre lines needed to draw **all** of the **first** \(n\) **diagrams** is
